Our democracy shouldn‚Äôt be bought and paid for by the wealthy and powerful. It belongs to all of us. Getting big money out of politics is a critical part of fighting corruption and making the big, structural change that we need.

Finally, we need to put power back in the hands of the people. So I will establish a public financing program that would give a 6-1 match for small dollar contributions to candidates and parties. And I'll lower the limits for how much individuals can contribute to campaigns.
üìÖ HEARING SCHEDULE FOR THIS WEEK: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EG7K3-6XkAMXM0q.jpg

We need to expand disclosure of fundraising and spending. The system of money for influence is helped at every stage by secrecy. We need to require additional disclosures by presidential campaigns, update laws for online political advertising, and bring dark money into the light.

I'll start by ending the corrupt system of money for influence. We must pass a constitutional amendment to overturn the Supreme Court‚Äôs disastrous decisions in Citizens United and Buckley v. Valeo. But we can and must also pass new campaign finance laws to shut down corruption.

This is a start, but voluntary changes aren‚Äôt going to be enough to clean up the corruption in our elections. That‚Äôs why when I‚Äôm president, I‚Äôll implement a comprehensive plan to permanently eliminate big money from our politics and return our democracy to the people.

Voters have a right to know who is buying access and recognition with the possible future leaders of our party‚Äîand how much it costs. So I‚Äôm also calling on every candidate in this race to disclose any donor or fundraiser who has a special title on their campaign.

Today, I‚Äôm announcing that in addition to these policies, I‚Äôm not going to take any contributions over $200 from executives at big tech companies, big banks, private equity firms, or hedge funds. My campaign is and will continue to be a grassroots campaign.

My campaign doesn‚Äôt take money from federal lobbyists or PACs, and I don't take contributions over $200 from fossil fuel or big pharma executives. No call time with rich donors or giving them special access. And when I‚Äôm the Democratic nominee, that won't change.

Corruption in Washington is holding back progress‚Äîand much of it is perfectly legal thanks to the Supreme Court. It‚Äôs time to get big money out of politics and put power back in the hands of the people‚Äîand I've got a plan for that. http://ewar.ren/campaign-finance

Robert ‚ÄúWoody‚Äù Johnson, the owner of the New York Jets who participated in a tax scheme that cost the U.S. Treasury an estimated $300 million, donated $1 million to Trump‚Äôs inaugural committee. For too long, we‚Äôve had the wrong mentality about the long-term dangers of concussions. These are serious injuries that can‚Äôt be shrugged off. Adopting the ‚Äúwhen in doubt, sit it out‚Äù policy will help increase student health and safety in youth sports.

My bill would require states to adopt ‚Äúwhen in doubt, sit it out‚Äù policies, which prevent student athletes suspected of having sustained a concussion from returning to play the same day and, after that, only once cleared by a qualified health care professional.

Nearly 140,000 high schoolers suffer concussions every year according to @NFHS_Org, though many go unreported. Today, I introduced the Protecting Student Athletes from Concussions Act to help elementary and secondary schools prevent, identify, & treat concussions.
